subject: Re: RS 12-469 Questions on How to Use
author: Rita
full_text:
Do you have to have it in a sound chamber?  Or would a quiet room 
work?  I saw the video on building the sound chamber for under $100, 
and may go that route--thank you for the info.

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "LC Duplatt" <lcdupla@...> wrote:
>
> Rita, I think you will have to get a pair of amplified speakers on 
> that 469, and put them in a sound chamber of some sort.  In that 
> chamber, you will want probably an amplified microphone running 
into 
> your voice recorder, to pick up the sounds bouncing around in 
there.  
> You can also add some white noise into the box, but I think people 
> are getting results without adding the additional noise. The 
chamber 
> seems to really bounce the sound around and give you a good mix to 
> record.
> 
> LC
>
